headline: Do Weather-Driven Rate Hikes Reveal Strengths or Strains in Con Edison’s Regulated Model (ED)?
summary: In recent weeks, Consolidated Edison has faced extreme cold weather in New York that drove higher gas and electricity usage, triggered state-approved rate hikes, and coincided with localized power outages affecting hundreds of customers in Brooklyn and Queens. This combination of rising customer bills, reliability concerns, and an upcoming earnings report with mixed analyst expectations has sharpened focus on how effectively Con Edison manages its regulated grid and cost base under stress...

headline: Is Consolidated Edison (ED) Still Attractive After Strong Multi‑Year Share Price Gains
summary: If you are wondering whether Consolidated Edison is priced attractively right now, it helps to step back and look at what the recent share performance and current valuation are really telling you. The stock last closed at US$113.72, with returns of 5.9% over 7 days, 12.1% over 30 days, 13.7% year to date, 23.9% over 1 year, 34.1% over 3 years and 97.4% over 5 years. This naturally raises questions about how much of this is already reflected in the price. Recent news coverage has focused on...

headline: Assessing Consolidated Edison (ED) Valuation As Rate Hike And Winter Demand Shift Earnings Outlook
summary: Consolidated Edison (ED) is back in focus after New York regulators approved higher delivery rates, just as the coldest winter in years drives heavier electricity and gas usage and pushes customer bills higher. See our latest analysis for Consolidated Edison. The rate approval and winter bill shock come as Consolidated Edison’s share price sits at $113.72, with a 30 day share price return of 12.07% and a 1 year total shareholder return of 23.94%. These figures indicate notable movement over...
